content:
I'm so glad to hear that you're excited to start with Emily! Conducting multiple interviews with her at different points in the story is an excellent idea. It will help you track her growth, changes, and motivations throughout the narrative.

Remember, the goal is to get into Emily's head and understand what makes her tick. Be curious, ask open-ended questions, and let her respond freely. Don't worry too much about grammar, spelling, or sentence structure – just focus on capturing her voice and personality.

It's great that you're reflecting on the writing workshop you took in October and how it helped you focus on your writing goals. This character interview exercise can have a similar effect on your character development. By getting to know Emily better, you'll be able to create a more authentic and relatable character, which will, in turn, strengthen your story.

As you conduct these interviews, keep in mind that character development is a process. It takes time, patience, and practice to get to know your characters intimately. But with persistence and dedication, you'll be able to craft a character that readers will love and root for.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I wish you all the best with your character interviews, and I hope you have a blast getting to know Emily better!

How do you think Emily will respond to some of the questions I provided earlier? Are there any specific areas you're hoping to explore or understand better about her character?
